required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Six-Week Flexible Dose Study Evaluating the Efficacy and Safety of Geodon in Patients With Bipolar I Depression.
clinical_study.official_title: A Six-Week, Double-Blind, Multicenter, Placebo-Controlled Study Evaluating the Efficacy and Safety of Flexible Doses of Oral Ziprasidone in Outpatients With Bipolar I Depression

brief_summary.textblock: This is a 6-week trial that evaluates the efficacy and safety of Geodon (ziprasidone) in outpatient subjects ages 18 and older with Bipolar Disorder type I, depressed. Subjects are required to undergo a washout period of at least 7 days of any prior med.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) Total Score

secondary_outcome.measure: Response Greater Than or Equal to 50 Percent Decrease From Baseline in Montgomery-Asberg Rating Scale (MADRS) Total Score
Response Greater Than or Equal to 50 Percent Decrease From Baseline in Hamilton Depression Rating Scale (HAM-D 17) Total Score
Remission as Measured by Montgomery Asberg Depression Scale (MADRS) Total Score Less Than or Equal to 12
Remission as Measured by Hamilton Asberg Depression Rating Scale (HAM-D 17) Total Score Less Than or Equal to 7

Change in Total Score in Hamiliton Depression Rating Scale (HAM-D 25)
Change in Bech Melancholia Score
Change in Anxiety/Somatizations Factor Total Score
Change in Retardation Factor Scores
Change in Sleep Disturbance Factor Score
Change in Hamilton Anxiety Rating (HAM-A)
Change in Total Score of Young Mania Rating Scale (YMRS)
Change in Global Clinical Severity of Symptoms (CGI-S)
Change in Global Clinical Improvement of Symptoms (CGI -I)
Change in Global Assessment of Functioning (GAF)
Change in Quality of Life, Enjoyment, and Satisfaction Scale (Q-LES-Q) Total Score
Change in Sheehan Disability Scale (SDS) Total Score
Change in Bipolar Cognition Rating Scale (BPCoRS) Interviewer Global Rating of Subject
Change in Bipolar Cognition Rating Scale (BPCoRS) Informant Global Rating
Change in Bipolar Cognition Rating Scale (BPCoRS) Global Rating by Interviewer
Change in Bipolar Cognition Rating Scale (BPCoRS) Subject Rating at Endpoint

arm_group.description: For the Ziprasidone arm, the Baseline card will contain 20 mg bid (one 20 mg capsule) for days 1-2 and 40 mg bid (two 20 mg capsules) for days 3-6. Cards A, B, C, and D will contain either 20 mg bid (one 20 mg capsule), 40 mg bid (two 20 mg capsules), 60 mg bid (one 60 mg capsule), or 80 mg bid (one 60 mg capsule and one 20 mg capsule).

intervention.description: Subjects will start on placebo and remain on placebo for six weeks. All cards for the Placebo arm will be 0 mg bid.

Ziprasidone flexible dosing treatment arm (20-80 mg bid). For the Ziprasidone arm, the Baseline card will contain 20 mg bid (one 20 mg capsule) for days 1-2 and 40 mg bid (two 20 mg capsules) for days 3-6. Cards A, B, C, and D will contain either 20 mg bid (one 20 mg capsule), 40 mg bid (two 20 mg capsules), 60 mg bid (one 60 mg capsule), or 80 mg bid (one 60 mg capsule and one 20 mg capsule).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjects must have a primary diagnosis of Bipolar I Disorder, most recent episode depressed, with or without rapid cycling, without psychotic features, as defined in DSM-IV-TR (296.5X) and confirmed by a structured Mini International Neuropsychiatric Interview (MINI)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects with a DSM-IV TR diagnosis of schizophrenia (295.XX), schizoaffective disorder (295.70), schizophreniform disorder (295.40), delusional disorder (297.1), or psychotic disorder NOS (298.9).
- Subjects with other DSM-IV TR Axis I or Axis II disorder (in addition to Bipolar I disorder) are ineligible if the comorbid condition is clinically unstable, requires treatment, or has been a primary focus of treatment within the 6 month period prior to screening.

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: 7 day washout: psychotropic drugs and lithium. 4 week washout: monoamine oxidase inhibitors. Depot neuroleptic DC'd 6 months before study entry.11 subjects assigned to but not treated with drug: 9 lost to follow up, 1 no longer willing to participate, 1 DC'd due to protocol violation

group.title: Ziprasidone 20-80mg Bid
group.description: For the Ziprasidone arm, the Baseline card will contain 20 milligrams (mg) twice daily (bid) (one 20 mg capsule) for days 1-2 and 40 mg bid (two 20 mg capsules) for days 3-6. Cards A, B, C, and D will contain either 20 mg bid (one 20 mg capsule), 40 mg bid (two 20 mg capsules), 60 mg bid (one 60 mg capsule), or 80 mg bid (one 60 mg capsule and one 20 mg capsule).

outcome.title: Response Greater Than or Equal to 50 Percent Decrease From Baseline in Montgomery-Asberg Rating Scale (MADRS) Total Score
outcome.description: Participants with MADRS Total Score greater than or equal to 50 percent decrease from baseline responded yes; others responded no. MADRS: 10-item instrument measuring depression; scale 0(Normal) & 6 (most abnormal)for each item. Total possible score is 0 - 60. Endpoint is last observation carried forward (LOCF)
outcome.population: Weeks 1 - 6 are Intent to treat (ITT) population Observed Cases Not all subjects responded at each week. Endpoint is ITT population Last Observation Carried Forward (LOCF)

group.title: Ziprasidone 20-80mg Bid

outcome.title: Response Greater Than or Equal to 50 Percent Decrease From Baseline in Hamilton Depression Rating Scale (HAM-D 17) Total Score
outcome.description: Participants with greater than or equal to 50 percent decrease from baseline in HAM-D 17 total score responded yes; others responded no. Total score is first 17 items of the HAM-D 25: measures range of depressive symptoms. Scale: 8 items 0-2 & 9 items 0-4, higher scores being more severe. Total possible score is 0 - 52. Endpoint is LOCF.
outcome.population: Weeks 3, 6 are Intent to treat (ITT) population Observed Cases. Not all subjects responded at each week. Endpoint is ITT population Last Observation Carried Forward (LOCF)

outcome.title: Change in Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) Total Score
outcome.description: Change is observed value at each visit minus baseline value. MADRS:10-item instrument measuring depression; scale range between 0(Normal) - 6(most abnormal)for each item. Total possible score is 0 - 60. Overall is average response Week 1 - Week 6.
outcome.population: Weeks 1 - 6 are Intent to treat (ITT) population Observed Cases. Overall is Average of Weeks 1 - 6.

group.title: Ziprasidone 20-80mg Bid
group.description: For the Ziprasidone arm, the Baseline card will contain 20 milligrams (mg) twice daily (bid) (one 20 mg capsule) for days 1-2 and 40 mg bid (two 20 mg capsules) for days 3-6. Cards A, B, C, and D will contain either 20 mg bid (one 20 mg capsule), 40 mg bid (two 20 mg capsules), 60 mg bid (one 60 mg capsule), or 80 mg bid (one 60 mg capsule and one 20 mg capsule).

measure.title: Change in Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) Total Score
measure.description: Change is observed value at each visit minus baseline value. MADRS:10-item instrument measuring depression; scale range between 0(Normal) - 6(most abnormal)for each item. Total possible score is 0 - 60. Overall is average response Week 1 - Week 6.
measure.population: Weeks 1 - 6 are Intent to treat (ITT) population Observed Cases. Overall is Average of Weeks 1 - 6.

analysis.p_value_desc: No multiple comparison adjustment is applicable. Statistical significance level was 0.05
analysis.method_desc: Fixed categorical: treatment, rapid cycling, center, visit, prior hosp & treatment-by-visit interaction & fixed continuous effect of baseline value
Fixed categorical: treatment, rapid cycling, center, visit, prior hosp & treatment-by-visit interaction & fixed continuous effect of baseline value

analysis.groups_desc: Week 6 An estimated sample size of 180 was needed per treatment arm in order to achieve 85% power to detect a treatment difference of 3.5 in the mean change from baseline to Week 6 in MADRS total score with a two-sided t-test at the 0.05 significance level. The common standard deviation was estimated as 11.0. The null hypotheses is equality of mean change from baseline to Week 6 in MADRS total score between ziprasidone and placebo groups.
analysis.method_desc: Fixed categorical: treatment, rapid cycling, center, visit, prior hosp & treatment-by-visit interaction & fixed continuous effect of baseline value

outcome.title: Change in Hamilton Depression Rating Scale (HAM-D 17) Total Score
outcome.description: Change is observed value at each visit minus baseline value. HAM-D 17 Total score is first 17 items of HAM-D 25; measures range of depressive symptoms patient currently experiencing. Scale: 8 items 0-2 & 9 items 0-4; 0=absent or not depressed, 2 or 4=most severe or extreme. Total possible score is 0 - 52.Endpoint is LOCF
outcome.population: Weeks 3, 6 are Intent to Treat (ITT) population Observed Cases. Endpoint is ITT population Last Observation Carried Forward (LOCF).

outcome.title: Change in Total Score in Hamiliton Depression Rating Scale (HAM-D 25)
outcome.description: Change is observed value at each visit minus baseline value. HAM-D: 25-item instrument measuring the range of depressive symptoms patient currently experiencing. Scale: 14 items 0-2 & 11 items 0-4; 0=absent or not depressed, 2 or 4=most severe or extreme. Total possible score is 0 - 72. Endpoint is LOCF.
outcome.population: Weeks 3, 6 are Intent to Treat (ITT) population Observed Cases. Endpoint is ITT population Last Observation Carried Forward (LOCF).

outcome.title: Change in Sleep Disturbance Factor Score
outcome.description: Change is observed value at each visit minus baseline value. Sleep Disturbance is the sum of scores of 3 items which pertain to sleep disturbance within Hamilton Depression Rating Scale (HAM-D). Scale range 0 to 4 with higher scores reflecting greater severity. Total possible score is 0 - 12.
outcome.population: Weeks 3, 6 are Intent to treat (ITT) population Observed Cases. Endpoint is ITT population Last Observation Carried Forward (LOCF)

Cards A, B, C, and D will contain either 20 mg bid (one 20 mg capsule), 40 mg bid (two 20 mg capsules), 60 mg bid (one 60 mg capsule), or 80 mg bid (one 60 mg capsule and one 20 mg capsule).

measure.title: Change in Sleep Disturbance Factor Score
measure.description: Change is observed value at each visit minus baseline value. Sleep Disturbance is the sum of scores of 3 items which pertain to sleep disturbance within Hamilton Depression Rating Scale (HAM-D). Scale range 0 to 4 with higher scores reflecting greater severity. Total possible score is 0 - 12.
measure.population: Weeks 3, 6 are Intent to treat (ITT) population Observed Cases. Endpoint is ITT population Last Observation Carried Forward (LOCF)

outcome.title: Change in Hamilton Anxiety Rating (HAM-A)
outcome.description: Change is observed value at each visit minus baseline value. HAM-A:14-item scale to rate the intensity of psychic anxiety (items 1- 6, 14) and somatic anxiety (items 7-13) on a 5-point severity scale (0=not present to 4=very severe). Total possible score is 0 - 56.
outcome.population: Weeks 3, 6 are Intent to treat (ITT) population Observed Cases. Endpoint is ITT population Last Observation Carried Forward (LOCF).

group.title: Ziprasidone 20-80mg Bid
group.description: For the Ziprasidone arm, the Baseline card will contain 20 milligrams (mg) twice daily (bid) (one 20 mg capsule) for days 1-2 and 40 mg bid (two 20 mg capsules) for days 3-6. Cards A, B, C, and D will contain either 20 mg bid (one 20 mg capsule), 40 mg bid (two 20 mg capsules), 60 mg bid (one 60 mg capsule), or 80 mg bid (one 60 mg capsule and one 20 mg capsule).

measure.title: Change in Hamilton Anxiety Rating (HAM-A)
measure.description: Change is observed value at each visit minus baseline value. HAM-A:14-item scale to rate the intensity of psychic anxiety (items 1- 6, 14) and somatic anxiety (items 7-13) on a 5-point severity scale (0=not present to 4=very severe). Total possible score is 0 - 56.
measure.population: Weeks 3, 6 are Intent to treat (ITT) population Observed Cases. Endpoint is ITT population Last Observation Carried Forward (LOCF).

outcome.title: Change in Total Score of Young Mania Rating Scale (YMRS)
outcome.description: Change is observed value at each visit minus baseline value. YMRS: 11 item instrument with scale range 0 to 4 for 7 items and 0 to 8 for 4 items. 0=normal; 4 or 8=most abnormal. Total possible score is 0 - 60. Overall is average response Week 1 - 6.
outcome.population: Week 1 - Week 6 is Intent to treat (ITT) population Observed Cases. Overall is Average of Weeks 1 – 6.

group.title: Ziprasidone 20-80mg Bid
group.description: For the Ziprasidone arm, the Baseline card will contain 20 milligrams (mg) twice daily (bid) (one 20 mg capsule) for days 1-2 and 40 mg bid (two 20 mg capsules) for days 3-6. Cards A, B, C, and D will contain either 20 mg bid (one 20 mg capsule), 40 mg bid (two 20 mg capsules), 60 mg bid (one 60 mg capsule), or 80 mg bid (one 60 mg capsule and one 20 mg capsule).

measure.description: Change is observed value at each visit minus baseline value. YMRS: 11 item instrument with scale range 0 to 4 for 7 items and 0 to 8 for 4 items. 0=normal; 4 or 8=most abnormal. Total possible score is 0 - 60. Overall is average response Week 1 - 6.
measure.population: Week 1 - Week 6 is Intent to treat (ITT) population Observed Cases. Overall is Average of Weeks 1 – 6.

outcome.title: Change in Global Assessment of Functioning (GAF)
outcome.description: Change is observed value at each visit minus baseline value. GAF is an instrument used to assess global psychological, social, & occupational functioning. Scale range: 100 = normal and 0 = greatest abnormality.
outcome.population: Endpoint is ITT population Last Observation Carried Forward (LOCF). n = 154, 169; N = 180, 190

group.title: Ziprasidone 20-80mg Bid
group.description: For the Ziprasidone arm, the Baseline card will contain 20 milligrams (mg) twice daily (bid) (one 20 mg capsule) for days 1-2 and 40 mg bid (two 20 mg capsules) for days 3-6. Cards A, B, C, and D will contain either 20 mg bid (one 20 mg capsule), 40 mg bid (two 20 mg capsules), 60 mg bid (one 60 mg capsule), or 80 mg bid (one 60 mg capsule and one 20 mg capsule).

measure.title: Change in Global Assessment of Functioning (GAF)
measure.description: Change is observed value at each visit minus baseline value. GAF is an instrument used to assess global psychological, social, & occupational functioning. Scale range: 100 = normal and 0 = greatest abnormality.
measure.population: Endpoint is ITT population Last Observation Carried Forward (LOCF). n = 154, 169; N = 180, 190

analysis.p_value_desc: For all secondary efficacy analyses, no multiple comparison adjustment were made
analysis.method_desc: ANCOVA model included effects of treatment, rapid cycling, center, prior hospitalization status, as well as baseline value as a covariate.

outcome.title: Change in Quality of Life, Enjoyment, and Satisfaction Scale (Q-LES-Q) Total Score
outcome.description: Change is observed value at each visit minus baseline value. Q-LES-Q: 16- item instrument for a patient's assessment of his/her quality of life. Scale range: overall level of satisfaction 1=very poor to 5=Very good. 1 item (medication)can be left blank. Total possible score 15 - 80.
outcome.population: Change from baseline to Endpoint. Endpoint is Intent to Treat (ITT) population Last Observation Carried Forward (LOCF). n = 153, 168; N = 180, 190

group.title: Ziprasidone 20-80mg Bid
group.description: For the Ziprasidone arm, the Baseline card will contain 20 milligrams (mg) twice daily (bid) (one 20 mg capsule) for days 1-2 and 40 mg bid (two 20 mg capsules) for days 3-6. Cards A, B, C, and D will contain either 20 mg bid (one 20 mg capsule), 40 mg bid (two 20 mg capsules), 60 mg bid (one 60 mg capsule), or 80 mg bid (one 60 mg capsule and one 20 mg capsule).

measure.title: Change in Quality of Life, Enjoyment, and Satisfaction Scale (Q-LES-Q) Total Score
measure.description: Change is observed value at each visit minus baseline value. Q-LES-Q: 16- item instrument for a patient's assessment of his/her quality of life. Scale range: overall level of satisfaction 1=very poor to 5=Very good. 1 item (medication)can be left blank. Total possible score 15 - 80.
measure.population: Change from baseline to Endpoint. Endpoint is Intent to Treat (ITT) population Last Observation Carried Forward (LOCF). n = 153, 168; N = 180, 190

analysis.p_value_desc: For all secondary efficacy analyses, no multiple comparison adjustment were made
analysis.method_desc: ANCOVA model included effects of treatment, rapid cycling, center, prior hospitalization status, as well as baseline value as a covariate.

outcome.title: Change in Sheehan Disability Scale (SDS) Total Score
outcome.description: Change is observed value at each visit minus baseline value. SDS is a patient rated measure of disability and impairment in work/school, social life, family life/home responsibilities. Scale range: 0-10 with 0=no disruption,10=extreme disruption. Total possible score is 0 - 30.
outcome.population: Baseline to Endpoint. Endpoint is ITT population Last Observation Carried Forward (LOCF). n = 149, 162; N = 180, 190

group.title: Ziprasidone 20-80mg Bid
group.description: For the Ziprasidone arm, the Baseline card will contain 20 milligrams (mg) twice daily (bid) (one 20 mg capsule) for days 1-2 and 40 mg bid (two 20 mg capsules) for days 3-6. Cards A, B, C, and D will contain either 20 mg bid (one 20 mg capsule), 40 mg bid (two 20 mg capsules), 60 mg bid (one 60 mg capsule), or 80 mg bid (one 60 mg capsule and one 20 mg capsule).

measure.title: Change in Sheehan Disability Scale (SDS) Total Score
measure.description: Change is observed value at each visit minus baseline value. SDS is a patient rated measure of disability and impairment in work/school, social life, family life/home responsibilities. Scale range: 0-10 with 0=no disruption,10=extreme disruption. Total possible score is 0 - 30.
measure.population: Baseline to Endpoint. Endpoint is ITT population Last Observation Carried Forward (LOCF). n = 149, 162; N = 180, 190

analysis.p_value_desc: For all secondary efficacy analyses, no multiple comparison adjustment were made
analysis.method_desc: ANCOVA model included effects of treatment, rapid cycling, center, prior hospitalization status, as well as baseline value as a covariate.

outcome.title: Change in Bipolar Cognition Rating Scale (BPCoRS) Interviewer Global Rating of Subject
outcome.description: Change is observed value at each visit minus baseline value. BPCoRs: Subject interview with 20-items measuring cognitive deficits & degree of affect on functioning. Scale range:0 to 4, higher numbers, greater impairment. Total possible score is 0 - 80. Endpoint=last observation carried forward (LOCF)
outcome.population: Baseline to Endpoint. Endpoint is Intent to Treat (ITT) population Last Observation Carried Forward (LOCF). n = 141, 164; N = 180, 190

group.title: Ziprasidone 20-80mg Bid
group.description: For the Ziprasidone arm, the Baseline card will contain 20 milligrams (mg) twice daily (bid) (one 20 mg capsule) for days 1-2 and 40 mg bid (two 20 mg capsules) for days 3-6. Cards A, B, C, and D will contain either 20 mg bid (one 20 mg capsule), 40 mg bid (two 20 mg capsules), 60 mg bid (one 60 mg capsule), or 80 mg bid (one 60 mg capsule and one 20 mg capsule).

measure.description: Change is observed value at each visit minus baseline value. BPCoRs: Subject interview with 20-items measuring cognitive deficits & degree of affect on functioning. measure.population: Baseline to Endpoint. Endpoint is Intent to Treat (ITT) population Last Observation Carried Forward (LOCF). n = 141, 164; N = 180, 190

outcome.title: Change in Bipolar Cognition Rating Scale (BPCoRS) Informant Global Rating
outcome.description: Change is observed value at each visit minus baseline value. Informant Global Rating is interview with informant of subject using BPCoRS, a 20-item instrument measuring cognitive deficits & degree of affect on functioning. Scale: 0 to 4, higher numbers = greater impairment. Total possible score is 0 - 80. Endpoint is LOCF.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of <60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), <12 mo from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential info other than study results.
